file_content.text: Reports indicate that SCORPIO controls the majority of the Eternal Fleet. But not all.
Arcann's flagship still commands a sizable armada. How he's blocking SCORPIO's influence... We don't know.
Might have something to do with GEMINI Prime's sudden urge to take a nap.
GEMINI Prime remains unresponsive. Doctor Oggurobb is running tests to see if there's a connection.
SCORPIO never expressed an interest in ruling the masses. She must have a larger plan for the Eternal Throne.
Something doesn't add up.
SCORPIO's never been shy about her conniving ways. I was foolish to think she made an exception for me.
I fell into SCORPIO's trap.
I'm going to enjoy breaking SCORPIO into scrap metal.
No one betrays me.
SCORPIO will pay for her betrayal.
SCORPIO will die. Painfully.
I will disassemble her, display the pieces, and make sure her sensors feel every second until my vengeance is satisfied.
SCORPIO has always been manipulative. I should have foreseen her betrayal.
This is my fault. I got sloppy.
Creepy always turns crazy--and not the good kind. Told you as much, but why listen to me?
Yikes. Even for you, that's... Yikes.
Replacing Arcann with a psychotic droid wasn't what I had in mind when we formed the Alliance.
SCORPIO knows too much. We're at a disadvantage.
She's made no moves against us. And without the Eternal Throne, Arcann is weakened.
Do not underestimate my son. We can deal with the droid later.
What's happening?
Someone's slicing into our communications.
Who?
I trust you have not forgotten me.
Our partnership is incomplete.
A partnership implies trust. You've proven untrustworthy.
We're not partners.
Come to beg for my forgiveness?
Is this an apology?
I'm going to melt you, limb by limb.
Your death will conclude it.
Do not embarrass yourself.
No, but it's sweet of you to think so.
I seized an opportunity. It wasn't personal.
This is merely a courtesy call. Arcann approaches Odessen. He intends to destroy the planet like he leveled Asylum.
How very Sith of you. In this instance, I don't mind.
That's not possible. He doesn't know our location.
I told him.
I was curious to see what was more important to Arcann: retaking the Eternal Throne or defeating you... and in turn, his father.
I refuse to be a pawn in whatever game you're orchestrating. You forget who you're talking to--I'm the master conspirator here.
You can't manipulate me.
You're not telling me this to appease your curiosity.
You're up to something.
Seriously, whose side are you on?
Are you helping me now?
Let him come. If he's so eager to die, I will indulge him.
Arcann doesn't frighten me.
I knew you would understand.
I have what I want. There is no reason for us to be enemies.
I rarely act with a singular motivation.
Mine, of course. But that doesn't mean we are enemies.
Arcann is a nuisance that must be dealt with. You are in the best position to do so.
She's not lying. Massive fleet inbound.
Thanks for the intel. Perhaps we can still work together.
[Lie] I appreciate the heads-up.
Don't get too comfortable. You're in my seat.
Keep the throne warm for me.
Make no mistake: you and Arcann will die by my hand.
You'll pay for your betrayal.
Promises, promises.
Yet it feels like it was made for me.
I can always count on your pragmatism.
We can counterattack. But we'll need people here, in case Arcann deploys ground troops.
Commander, I'd like to stay here, help defend the Alliance camp.
I'll hang back as well. Major Paws would be lost without me.
You done?
Might want to leave someone else to mediate.
I feel safer knowing Odessen will be defended by Havoc Squad.
The Alliance depends on this base. Extra help won't hurt.
I'll stay. Might have deserters. They'll be great target practice.
You're disgusting.
I'd leave someone else behind to make sure Kaliyo doesn't get too trigger happy.
If anyone can keep these two in line, it's a Mandalorian.
Torian can handle it.
Vette, you're reasonably level-headed. Make sure these two don't burn the camp down.
Vette, you're up.
Gault, you're creative. Keep these two from killing each other.
Leave that to Gault.
A major of Havoc Squad and a Mandalorian--sounds like a dream team.
Torian should stay, too.
Vette, help Jorgan. Your survival instincts could be beneficial to Odessen's defense.
Vette can help here.
We'll need more than tactics if Arcann reaches Odessen. Gault can improvise on short notice.
Gault, you're up.
Mandalorians abide by a code of honor. Torian, keep an eye on Kaliyo.
Torian can handle that.
Vette. Stay with Kaliyo. I need someone I trust defending Odessen.
Leave that to Vette.
I've wrangled bigger beasts. Leave it to me.
He's a Major and she's a lunatic. What do you expect me to do?
I'm a con artist, not a babysitter.
No one's getting past us, Commander.
My survival instincts are telling me to run away, but sure.
My improvisation is more awe-inspiring when I have a big gun to hide behind. And credits are involved.
I may regret this, but... Gault, watch Kaliyo. You seem to understand each other.
Gault, you're up.
Me? With her? I think I'd rather face Arcann.
You have my word.
Finally have time for that drink.
Everyone else, head to the Gravestone. Arcann's reign ends today.
Let's grab the Phantom and get off this rock. Put all these complications behind us.
Always said I'd never give you up. It took an Empire to separate us.
Would you listen if I asked you to be careful?
Depends on how you asked.
I could be convinced.
I like risks, you know that.
Probably not.
You're not going to lose me, Theron. I know you have abandonment issues, but...
Stop worrying. I'll be fine.
How's that?
I'll be careful.
You're a terrible liar.
If that's true, I doubt she'll share it with us.
Relax. Just a couple blasts to the legs.
You're about to lose your other horn.
I can live with that...
Underneath that callous exterior is a big heart.
You don't mean that.
Can't say the thought hasn't crossed my mind, but there are some complications you can't escape.
Tempting, but not an option.
As long as you and I are together, there will always be complications. It's what makes this fun.
You love this.
You're so certain.
That's not fair.
Proved my point, though.
Yeah, yeah. You're always right. I'm crazy about you.
Well-founded issues--can we not talk about my mom right now?
Am I ruining the moment?
It's salvageable.
But now, I have to watch you go. And this time, you might not come back.
I'm coming back, Jorgan. We've already lost enough time.
I will.
I love it when you scowl.
Stop being so serious.
I have to go, Jorgan. You know that.
This is the job.
I'll say.
Just be careful. You'll put me in an early grave making me worry.
Don't change the subject. This is serious.
I'd rather spend our time doing something more productive.
You'll be the death of me, woman.
Early graves aren't in our future. Watching out for each other is what will keep us alive.
Doesn't mean I can't worry.
When I get back, let's talk about that long-overdue vacation.
Absolutely.
If you die--again--don't expect me to play the grieving widow.
I'd shoot myself before putting flowers on your grave.
Flowers are overrated.
There really isn't.
You care, or you would have left already. I've never held you back.
Fair warning: if Arcann runs you through, I'm not sticking around to help these losers.
Guess that's true. I tried to escape you. Look where that got me.
It's not all bad.
There's perks. But when this is finished, I expect some time away from "Camp Commander."
And I can always count on your arrogance.
